boat.name: Emerald
boat.full_description:
'Emerald' has been based on the Clyde since 1997, being sold in 2017 when she moved south to the East Coast of England.

A much admired Albert Strange gaff yawl, she was built in 1938 at Deganwy, North Wales by Williams & Parkinson. Based on the lines of 'Cherub III' she is 28ft 6in on deck.

Much loved and admired, she is fitted with a Yanmar 20hp diesel with Aquadrive and Gori feathering propeller. A safe, fast and very comfortable yacht, she has cruised extensively in Scottish and Irish Sea waters.
boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine on grown oak frames with steamed oak timbers
boat.short_description: Albert Strange, design no 112, her engine from 1975 to 2005, a Yanmar 10hp, is now in the Yanmar museum.

for_sales.sales_text:
Much admired Albert Strange Gaff Yawl. Built in 1938 in Deganwy, North Wales by Williams & Parkinson. Based on the lines of "Cherub III" she is 28ft 6in on deck.

This much loved and admired boat has been in the same very experienced ownership for many years and is now ready for more adventures in new hands.

Very well maintained and equipped, she is fitted with a Yanmar 20hp diesel with Aquadrive and Gori feathering propeller. A full inventory of sails, covers, and awnings is included. She has a Taylors cooker, Furuno GPS, VHF,  echo sounder, auto pilot, EPIRB and much much more.

A safe, fast and very comfortable yacht, she has cruised extensively in Scottish and Irish Sea waters. Currently lying Isle of Bute, Scotland.
